newsitem.title: DENMARK: JP Morgan sees higher Danish 1997 GDP, lower CPI.
newsitem.headline: JP Morgan sees higher Danish 1997 GDP, lower CPI.

text.p: In its latest survey U.S. investment bank JP Morgan on Wednesday raised its forecast for Denmark's 1997 GDP (gross domestic product) growth rate to 3.4 percent from 3.2 percent in its last forecast in March.

At the same time it cut its expectations for 1997 inflation to 2.2 percent from 2.7 percent and increased its estimate for the year's current account surplus to 10.7 billion crowns from 8.0 billion crowns.
The latest Danish Economy Ministry forecast in May foresaw 3.3 percent GDP growth, 2.3 percent inflation, 7.8 percent unemployment and a current account surplus of 12.0 billion crowns for this year.
The following estimates were made by 10 leading local and international organisations in recent months.
